prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with rounded corners and two cylindrical holes on opposite sides. Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: (0.0, 0.0, -90.0) - Translation Vector: (0.0, 0.1, 0.0) Step 2: Draw the 2D sketch for the base In the XY-plane of the new coordinate system, draw a 2D sketch as follows: 1. Draw the outer rectangle outline: - Start Point: (0.0, 0.05) - End Point: (0.75, 0.15) 2. Draw the top rectangle outline: - Start Point: (0.05, 0.0) - End Point: (0.7, 0.1) 3. Draw two arcs: - Arc 1: - Start Point: (0.0, 0.05) - Mid Point: (0.0146, 0.0146) - End Point: (0.05, 0.0) - Arc 2: - Start Point: (0.75, 0.15) - Mid Point: (0.7354, 0.1354) - End Point: (0.7, 0.1) Step 3: Add constraints to the 2D sketch 1. Close the outer rectangle loop 2. Close the top rectangle loop 3. Set the radius of Arcs 1 and 2 as 0.025 (constrained to the center points) 4. Set the radius of the bottom circles (Loop 2 and Loop 3) as 0.025 Step 4: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Step 5: Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch Using the new coordinate system properties, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D space. Step 6: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Using an extrusion depth of 0.1 towards the normal and 0.0 towards the opposite normal, extrude the 2D sketch along the Z-axis, creating the first intermediate part CAD model. Dimensions Length: 0.75 Width: 0.1 Height: 0.75 This concludes the instructions for part 1. Continue generating the details according to the JSON, making sure each part follows the same structure. Keep the parts consistent by referring to this outline and updating the necessary details accordingly.</description>
